RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the group: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: Defendant who pled guilty to transporting undocumented aliens for financial gain and acted as a guide into the United States, guiding a group of nine aliens including Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, and had his base offense level enhanced due to recklessly creating a substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury. He is argued to not have engaged in reckless conduct similar to that listed in the guideline commentary.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.KING: Chief Judge presiding over the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: undocumented female alien who died from probable heat stroke during the journey
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jaime Gomez-Arroyo: uncle of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez who met with border patrol agents and remained behind with her when she became ill
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Si: group of nine aliens being guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero for financial gain
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Cuyler: reference in a legal context related to reckless conduct in the transportation of illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rodriguez: defendants in a case involving guiding illegal aliens into the United States via the mountains between Mexico and San Diego
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero and others: defendants involved in cases related to the transportation of undocumented aliens
